Class DumpNodesRegime

java.lang.Object
net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes.DelegatedRegime
net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes.DumpNodesRegime
All Implemented Interfaces:
HyperparameterConfigurable, Regime
@Strategy(CONCRETE) public class DumpNodesRegime extends DelegatedRegime
A Regime decorator that dumps the internal node activations of a NeuralNetwork before and/or after each training epoch.

This regime is typically used for debugging and inspection. It wraps another regime, delegates the actual training to it, and uses NeuralNetworks.dump(NeuralNetwork, boolean) to output the state of the network. The dump can optionally include input nodes.

Behavior

  • If firstTime is true, the network is dumped once before the first training step.
  • The network is always dumped after each delegated training epoch.
  • If includeInputs is true, input node values are included in the dump; otherwise only hidden and output nodes are dumped.
See Also:
  • NeuralNetworks.dump(NeuralNetwork, boolean)
  • DelegatedRegime

  • Constructor Details

    • DumpNodesRegime

      public DumpNodesRegime(Regime regime, boolean firstTime, boolean includeInputs)
      Creates a new regime that dumps node values of the given network during training.
      Parameters:
      regime - the underlying regime to delegate training to
      firstTime - if true, the network is dumped once before training begins
      includeInputs - if true, input nodes are included in the dump

  • Method Details

    • isFirstTime

      public boolean isFirstTime()
      Returns whether the network will be dumped once before training starts.
      Returns:
      true if the network is dumped before the first epoch, otherwise false

    • setFirstTime

      public void setFirstTime(boolean firstTime)
      Sets whether the network should be dumped before training begins.
      Parameters:
      firstTime - true to dump before the first epoch, false otherwise

    • isIncludeInputs

      public boolean isIncludeInputs()
      Returns whether input nodes are included in the dump.
      Returns:
      true if input nodes are included, false otherwise

    • setIncludeInputs

      public void setIncludeInputs(boolean includeInputs)
      Sets whether to include input nodes in the dump.
      Parameters:
      includeInputs - true to include input nodes, false otherwise

    • train

      public <E extends TrainableFunction<N>, N extends Number> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet<N> trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction<N> objective, Optimizer<? super E, N> optimizer)
      Trains the given estimation function with the wrapped regime and dumps the network nodes before and/or after training.

      If the estimation function is a NeuralNetwork, its nodes are printed using NeuralNetworks.dump(NeuralNetwork, boolean).

      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of estimation function
      Parameters:
      estimationFunction - the model to train (only NeuralNetwork is dumped)
      trainingSet - the dataset to train on
      objective - the objective (loss) function
      optimizer - the optimizer to apply updates

    • train

      public <E extends TrainableFunction<N>, N extends Number> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet<N> trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction<N> objective, Optimizer<? super E, N> optimizer, int step)
